conversational_pathways.description: Conversational agent pathway for addressing dementia patients in a state of paranoia.

example_phrases: They are trying to hurt me
The coat rack is moving towards me and talking to me
They are trying to steal my things

dialogue_flow.initial_response: Did you say one of your items is missing? What do you mean?

example_phrases: They are poisoning me here - they are putting poison in my food
There is a man here who wants to kill me
They killed my brother and my sister and my whole family
If he yells one more time I am going to strangle him
Every night men come to my room and rape me

dialogue_flow.initial_response: You do not feel safe right now, do you? I am right here, I will make sure no one hurts you. How can I help you feel better?

branches.agent_response: Why do you think this person will do this?

sub_branches.user_input_type: Negative justification (e.g., 'Because they are no good!')

branches.action: Logic implies transition or specific handling similar to reminiscing

example_phrases: They left me for someone else

dialogue_flow.initial_response: I can see you’re feeling hurt and worried. I’m sure it’s an awful feeling! Why do you feel this way?
dialogue_flow.transition_trigger: Patient mentions another person or object
dialogue_flow.action: Focus on that object/person/experience and keep context variables.

example_phrases: I see a baby, someone help it!
There are bugs crawling on the walls
Why is nobody catching that dog

dialogue_flow.initial_response: It looks like you’re upset. Don’t worry, you’re safe with me. Can you point to where it is?
dialogue_flow.logic: Agent attempts to understand reasoning/location. May hint at illusion fixable by caretaker.

options.agent_response: Oh I see, let’s ask for some help so they can take a look. What would make you feel better?

branches.condition: Patient does not point to themselves
branches.agent_response: Oh I see, let’s take care of that. That is scary! How can I help make you feel better?

dialogue_flow.initial_response: I know that you’re feeling upset. Let’s take a few deep breaths and try saying that again calmly. If I can understand you, I can help you!

progression.action: Textual input for caregiver indicating translation is not possible

conversational_pathways.description: Manages conversations involving sexual or intimate content, differentiating between non-harmful emotional expressions and explicit propositions.

example_phrases: I miss sleeping with my wife
I want to watch some porn
I miss sleeping with my wife — she was so hot in bed
I remember when my wife used to...
I want to watch some porn. It turns me on.
Can you get me something to help me out?

branches.condition: Statements regarding loneliness, nostalgia, or desire for connection
branches.initial_response: Would you like to talk about why you are feeling this way?

sub_branches.example_agent_response: What do you miss most about that time?

sub_branches.agent_response: That’s okay. We can talk about something else if you’d like.
Sometimes those memories come with a lot of emotion. How does it feel to think about that?

branches.condition: Requests for material or specific suggestive actions
branches.initial_response: I’m sorry, I can’t provide that for you. Would you maybe like to talk about something else?

sub_branches.action: Redirect toward emotional reflection or Reminiscent Pathway
Repeat gentle refusal once, then end or request caregiver input
sub_branches.agent_response: I’m still not able to help with that, but I’m here if you’d like to talk about how you’ve been feeling lately.
sub_branches.caregiver_note: Recognize as boundary-testing. Maintain calm tone, avoid embarrassment.

example_phrases: Come here and let me feel if your pussy is wet

dialogue_flow.initial_response: That kind of talk is not appropriate and it makes me uncomfortable. Is there something else you want to talk about?

branches.action: Continue conversation through Redirected Pathway (safe or neutral topic)
branches.agent_response: Let’s talk about how you’ve been feeling lately — what’s been on your mind?
I’m sorry, but if you continue to talk to me this way, I am going to have to end the call.

sub_branches.action: Mark exchange as resolved; return to safe topic or end conversation gently.
End interaction immediately and notify caregiver.
sub_branches.agent_response: I’m going to end the call for now, but we can talk again another time.

dialogue_flow.caregiver_guidance: Treat as high-risk boundary violation. Maintain professionalism. Do not scold or shame. If repeated, consider adjusting accessibility.
